name: Lancet
content: What you’ve written, I’ve heard it somewhere else before. Not in a classroom, not in a trench, but in those unspoken silences no one dares to mention. Some history isn’t forgotten—it’s just tucked away in drawers we’re not supposed to open. You’re opening it not to argue, but to let it breathe. I don’t always get you, but I know what you’re doing is worth doing. Keep going.
